lead_paragraph: Vikings cornerback Fred Smoot and tackle Bryant McKinnie will go on trial on charges stemming from a boat-party sex scandal. Smoot's trial is scheduled to begin May 30, and McKinnie's is scheduled for July 7. Both players are charged with misdemeanor disorderly conduct, indecent conduct and lewd and lascivious behavior. Neither player appeared in court yesterday for a hearing that was expected to deal with defense motions to dismiss charges.
